mortality.note: Near-total destruction of Dzungar people. Qianlong explicitly ordered extermination. Survivors fled to Russia or were enslaved. Smallpox epidemic killed many survivors. Region repopulated with Han, Uyghur, and other groups. One of history's most complete genocides.

rationales.systematic_intensity: Qing Emperor Qianlong ordered complete elimination of Dzungar people. Military campaigns 1755-1758.
rationales.profit: Land seizure for Qing expansion and resettlement. Control of Central Asian trade routes.
rationales.ideology: Framed as eliminating a threat to Qing rule, but ethnic targeting was explicit.
rationales.complicity: Qing military and settlers benefited from depopulated lands. Still denied by China today.

analysis.pattern_note: One of the most complete genocides in history - 80% of an entire people killed in 3 years. Qianlong Emperor's own words: 'Show no mercy at all to these rebels. Only the old and weak should be saved.' Dzungars were last nomadic empire to challenge Qing. Their elimination opened Xinjiang for settlement. Critical context for understanding current Uyghur situation in same region.
analysis.root_causes: Imperial expansion, fear of nomadic military power, desire for territory
